title: Za’atar Goat Cheese Dip
ingredients: 6ounces (170 g) soft fresh goat cheese, at room temperature
¼cup (60 ml) whole-milk Greek yogurt (we like Fage)
1teaspoon honey, plus more for serving if desired
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
directions: Combine the goat cheese, yogurt, lemon zest, garlic, za’atar, oil, and honey in a medium bowl and beat with a spoon to blend and lighten the texture a little. Taste and add salt—most goat cheeses are salty, so you shouldn’t need much—and pepper. Drizzle with silan (if using) or more honey and serve.

The dip can be stored in an airtight container in the fridge for 3 to 4 days—it will firm up a bit and needs to be beaten again before serving. You can also add a little water or yogurt to reach the desired consistency. Use whatever is left as a snack with crackers or pita or as a sauce for making a boureka (page 322).
